economic_context.details: Multiple disputes related to carpenter trade competition. Nicolas Charpentier warned that accused would be envious he was taking away trade from her husband. Job le Maire angry because accused's husband managed to get separate deal at sawmill despite witness having contract to turn all tree-trunks into planks. Dispute over payment for carpentry work. Nicolas Geliat testified accused and husband had poor land where nothing grew, while Geliats had better land, source of taunting. Accused described as 'fort envieuse de nature' (very envious by nature).

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a particularly rich trial record with extensive witness testimony. Key features: (1) The case heavily involves testimony about the accused's young son Cesar, who told elaborate stories at school about a 'little black dog' that took him and his mother to sabbats and ate with them. These children's stories appear to have significantly strengthened the reputation and led to the trial. (2) The accused initially denied everything, then reluctantly made partial admissions, blaming her son ('le mal enfant il veut bien estre cause de ma damnation'). Full confession only came under torture (thumbscrews and rack). (3) Economic context is significant: multiple references to envy over land quality, carpenter trade competition, and accused described as 'fort envieuse de nature.' (4) The Change de Nancy was consulted twice (for torture approval and death sentence approval) and approved both. (5) Witness ages range from 13 to 80, with reputation testimony spanning up to 40 years. (6) Pattern of alleged harms primarily involves animal deaths (cattle, pigs, oxen) following quarrels, plus some human illnesses and one death. (7) Accused named both dead and living accomplices, but later expressed uncertainty about identifying the living ones from Saulceray. (8) Family context: accused's stepmother was burned as witch and had accused one of her own daughters. Note: Witnesses 14 and 15 were not sworn in due to young age (under 13 and 13 respectively).
